Real-World Inspiration:
ECG: P-waves, T-waves, baseline drift (0.05-5 Hz)
EEG: Delta/Theta waves (0.5-8 Hz)
Justification: Captures slow physiological rhythms and morphological features

Real-World Inspiration:
ECG: QRS complex (10-100 Hz)
EEG: Beta/Gamma waves (13-100 Hz)
Justification: Captures fast transients and high-frequency components

Real-World Inspiration:
Speech: Syllable-level amplitude modulation
ECG: Heart rate variability envelope
Justification: Spline interpolation mimics natural amplitude dynamics

Real-World Inspiration:
ECG: Baseline wander from respiration
EEG: DC offset drift

Speech: Pitch contours (F0 variation)
ECG: Inter-beat interval variation
Justification: Smooth frequency variation matches prosodic patterns

Real-World Inspiration:
ECG: 50/60 Hz powerline interference
Universal artifact in biomedical signals
Justification: Addresses R1-4: Models ubiquitous powerline interference

Real-World Inspiration:
ECG: Muscle noise, thermal noise
Speech: Background noise, microphone hiss
Justification: White noise floor present in all measurement systems

Real-World Inspiration:
ECG @ 500 Hz: 10 seconds of recording
Speech @ 48 kHz: ~100 ms segment
Justification: Standard segment length for ML training
